See [editing pdf exports|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+the+PDF+Stylesheet#EditingthePDFStylesheet-Addingpagenumberingtoaheaderorfooter] for how-to.
fields.summary: Add page numbers to documentation

fields.description:
Last, but not least, is the fact that Bamboo uses
DefaultSVNAuthenticationManager. Personally, I think that it would be
not only safer, but also more "correct" to use custom implementation of
ISVNAuthenticationManager - this will allow to store all credentials
within Bamboo application, not as something belonging to the user. It
would be also much easier to configure repository access credentials
from Bamboo user interface and there will be no problems like [one we're
discussing currently|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-4517] (though of course it should be fixed!).
fields.summary: Bamboo to use svnkit ISVNAuthenticationManager instead of DefaultSVNAuthenticationManager

fields.description:
Just noticed that the text for the I18n key {{build.dependency.strategy.buildParentIfHasChanges}} is missing. (see attachment)

The language jar does contain the key: {{build.dependency.strategy.dont_build_if_parent_in_queue_or_has_changes}}

Cheers,
Mark
fields.summary: Text missing for I18n key build.dependency.strategy.buildParentIfHasChanges

fields.description:
Running a Bamboo build in CI mode.

After recent SVN checkin, Bamboo builds are receiving the attached message in the Bamboo agent's log.  Once the build fails it loops and tries again.  For now, the build plan has been disabled.

The SVN repo has ~40,000 elements to be fetched.  Several thousand were added with the check-in that resulted in the first failed build.

I tried starting the Bamboo agent with "-Xmx2048m" and received the same message.

Any suggestions?
fields.summary: "java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space" message in Bamboo when trying to fetch large repository from SVN

fields.description: It would be great to be able to create a new build plan from a remote API. (in our case from an eclipse plugin)
fields.summary: Add ability to create new build plan with the remote API

So we should do our own check when we add the gadgets instead.

fields.description:
users should be able to comment/label individual testcases.

For example to display test properties per testcase there should be means to add this information on a testcase result level.
fields.summary: make label and comments available on all levels of build results down to _per testcase_ basis

fields.description: We use CVS module aliases extensively. The "&" module trick has enabled us to use bamboo with our current CVS layout. The only limitation of this trick is that we need to do a fresh CVS checkout with each build. This is because we have lots of extra code in the directories checked out which are not included in the specific module being compiled. Bamboo uses the "-d" option when running the CVS update command which results in an unnecessary checkout of a lot of additional code.
fields.summary: Ability to configure CVS options used when updating source code. Specifically, the ability to prevent the use of "-d".
NPE on Export

fields.description:
Instead of using system wide variables, I am trying to handle this using bamboo only, and the agent configuration. When passing the necessary variable in via the startup script on the agent (example: adding -Djboss.location=/Applications/jboss/... on MacOS X, -Djboss.location=/opt/jboss-eap on Linux, etc.),

these capabilities should be accessible via ${system.jboss.location} for plan configuration.
fields.summary: agent capabilities/properties can be specified via the command line when the agent is started

We need to verify the nant plugin that ships with bamboo.

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-2112

Windows installation, .NET installation with msbuilder, bamboo plan that executes on msbuilder

fields.description:
once jira has finalised its own dependencies...

To ensure gadgets actually work we will probably need to ensure that our oauth, atlasian-plugins and atlassian-gadgets libraries are updated to the same version as jira 4.0 and then double check that all the gadgets work.
fields.summary: Update Dependencies to match jira's (again)

fields.description:
We apparently need to repackage the plugin.  Don't entirely understand why...




From Justus:

The short version:

I just checked in a change to JIRA that will require plugins to be recompiled and redeployed as a new version but shouldn't require any source changes in order to work with our next release of JIRA 4.0. If you have questions, problems, or my claims about it just being a simple recompile turn out to be a dirty lie, let me know ASAP and we can work through the issues.


The longer version:

The FieldVisibilityBean is a concrete class. This causes problems in OSGi/plugins2 because it doesn't implement an interface that we can proxy to Spring. This means that it can't be constructor injected and people who need a FieldVisiblityBean have to come up with hacks and workarounds.

I just checked in a fix for JRA-18431 (which comes from AGS-1394) in svn revision 97568 which introduces a FieldVisibilityManager interface and FieldVisibilityManagerImpl implementation.

The FieldVisibilityBean is still in place but is deprecated.

The biggest visible change is that certain constructors (in Indexers, Renderers, and Searchers) now take a FieldVisibilityManager instead of a FieldVisibilityBean. Since you were passing in a FieldVisibilityBean before, and FieldVisibilityBean implements FieldVisibilityManager, there should be no source code changes required.
fields.summary: Update JIRA plugin to use FieldVisibilityManager rather than FieldVisibilityBean

fields.description:
The bamboo build cycle should be made flexible to be able to include the execution of scripts at any phase of the build cycle.
So far the pre post build plugin allows to call scripts immediately before and after the 'build' phase.
Other phases that should allow calling scripts
* Source repository actions such as checkout and update
* notifications
* indexing
* individual plan expiry process
* ...
fields.summary: Allow customizable build cycle by providing script hooks along all phases of the cycle
Add path to clover gadget to the list of gadgets available

fields.description:
The Clover HTML report is currently displayed in an iframe, which causes double scroll bars to display if the window is not the correct height.

The solution to remove the double scroll bars appears to be:
 * add a proper floating footer to Bamboo - [example|http://www.lwis.net/profile/CSS/sticky-footer.html]
 * set the height of the iframe of containing the Clover pages to the height of the available content space. Basically use JavaScript to subtract the offset.top of the iframe from the offset.top of the footer and tell the iframe to be this tall. Accommodation needs to be made for any intrusive padding in the page.
 * if the window is resized, adjust the height of the iframe accordingly.

This is a similar approach to how the Crucible review UI works.


BAM-4479 has been created for the changes required in bamboo core.
fields.summary: Remove double scroll bars from Clover panel.

fields.description: This will ensure the scroll bars don't always display.
fields.summary: Fix Bamboo footer, remove html { height: 100% } from css

Import with duplicate users in Hibernate and LDAP will fail if LDAP is enabled when importing 

# bamboo export with duplicated users (same username in ldap and hibernate) works without problems
# import _with ldap enabled_ of above export causes an error {panel}2009-09-01 12:08:53,172 INFO [4236043@qtp-3658896-2] [XmlMigrator] Using com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.ServerIDMapper to import.
2009-09-01 12:08:53,180 INFO [4236043@qtp-3658896-2] [XmlMigrator] Using com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.UserMapper to import.

com.atlassian.core.exception.InfrastructureException: com.atlassian.user.impl.DuplicateEntityException: User [ukuhnhardt] already exists in AD Repository
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.user.BambooUserManagerImpl.injectUser(BambooUserManagerImpl.java:472)
{panel}
# import _without ldap enabled_ of above export runs through - however 
-- group memeberships of external users are not maintained and lost.
-- global permissions for external groups are lost

Bamboo should not export duplicated users or handle user duplication during import
fields.summary: Handle import with LDAP enabled

fields.summary: manual and scheduled shutdown of elastic instance fails to delete attached ebs volumes

fields.description:
When running the bamboo.sh script during startup the application throws exceptions according to the attachment. I'm a newbie to java so I do not know where to start looking for troubles.

One thing has been modified for this startup compared to the standard startup. I have modified the port from 8085 to 8095 as the former already is allocated.

Exceptions:
java.lang.RuntimeException: Encryption algorithm not found
fields.summary: Exceptions thrown during application startup.
Trying to see how this application works
Ensuring the order order of shipped plugins are correct
Weight for execution order

fields.description:
* on the build config screen if a "global" license exists then we display a message indicating that a license is already configured.
* on the build config screen if a "global" license exists AND the license is valid then we display a message indicating that a license is valid.
* on the build config screen if a "global" license exists AND the license is invalid then we display a message indicating that a license is NOT valid
* on the build config screen if NO "global" license exists then a text entry field should be available and a message indicating that a license is required should be displayed.
* a text entry field should be available on the build config screen to allow the license to be overridden at the plan level.
* If _any_ license is defined at a plan level, it takes precedence

* Check interaction with clover.license in the settings.xml*
Validation of lic. is optional nice to have iff extras supports decoding.
fields.summary: Allow a clover license to be entered via the Bamboo admin (ie a global license).  License can be overridden at the plan config level
Rename "Bamboo Builds" tab in JIRA Bamboo plugin to be "Builds"

fields.description:
If i try to create a plan, the builder page is cut short (at the 'Build Sandbox' section). This means that I can't progress to the next step (Requirements) in the wizard, as the Next button does not display. 

This only happens in IE7, it's fine in FF.
fields.summary: "Create Plan - Builder" page is cropped short in IE7

fields.description: If startup of EBS volume fails for an instance, the Agent should start as disabled.
fields.summary: Failed EBS volume creaion should start as disabled
Merge REST updates from trunk to branch

fields.description: In our environment we have to create a number of different plans per project, to handle the different build steps and promotions. Creating the builds for each plan via the GUI is tedious and error-prone, so it would be very useful to have a REST API for plan creation (and updating). I can't seem to find any remote API's on this aspect of configuration, though..
fields.summary: Rest API for plan creation

fields.description:
If Bamboo is integrated with Crowd before, running through the setup wizard then the Bamboo installation will fail, as Bamboo can't create the first admin user.

We should update our Crowd docs to warn users, that they should run the setup wizard before integrating with Crowd.
fields.summary: Warn users not to set-up Crowd authentication, before configuring Bamboo.
Build reorder section does not show up on the BuildQueue screen

fields.description:
We are running into sync problems with p4 repositories VERY FREQUENTLY.
The [p4 sync -p command|http://www.perforce.com/perforce/doc.current/manuals/cmdref/sync.html] offers a way to 'populate the workspace' without updating the have list on the server.
fields.summary: Use Perfoce sync -p option to ignore have list
Bad returnUrl links after AJAX reload on "Current Activity" page

fields.summary: NPE on upgrade task 1502

fields.description:
From Scott - 

Ensure you're logged off to Bamboo and cookies are cleared.
Enter URL the protected page you're going to. It redirects you to login.
Logging in takes you to the dashboard instead of the expected page.
fields.summary: Redirect after login doesn't work if cookies are cleared

fields.description: The "Live activity log" page does not give me a comments tab to comment on a currently running build.
fields.summary: Ability to comment on a  currently building build

fields.description: Takes in excess of 30 seconds to navigate to the 2nd page of the list
fields.summary: Navigating between pages in /admin/group/viewGroups.action is really slow for crowd backed instances

fields.description:
Currently, when a build fails - an email notification is sent to the associated committers with a subject line similar to

"[Bamboo] SomeProject - trunk-clean build 18 has FAILED. Change made by Joe Blow"

I have received complaints that this subject line is too accusatory (it accuses the person of having broken the build). Specially when the person is part of a list and they may not have been the actual person to break the build.  

So. Regardless of the validity of the above complaints, I would like to be able to change the subject line to something else of my choosing - ideally with a more tactful message.  

The body of the message is easily customizable through templates.  However, in reading around 
(and I haven't looked at the source code yet) I have seen comments to the effect that 
the subject line of build notification emails are hard coded in the BuildResultsRenderer class.

If this is the situation, could you please at least expose the MessageFormat strings outside the code so that they may be modified without having to recompile the app?
fields.summary: Need to be able to change notification email subject

fields.description:
I have a project where I could not use the default maven pom.xml file. I have to use different name and want to mention the name using -f parameter provided by maven.

But bamboo not accepting this as System environment and not as part of maven goal.

Kindly provide the feature to accept the -f parameter in the maven build. If you already have that feature, kindly update the issue with that information. 

I appreciate your help.

Thanks
Lakshmanan
fields.summary: feature to specify POM file name
Plan Summary gadget - handle error responses

fields.description: make some test cases to test actions
fields.summary: Write tests for ConfigLog4j

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMEXT/CheckStyle+Plugin

The FECRU guys want to use this plugin in their BEAC builds.  according to this [comment|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMEXT/CheckStyle+Plugin?focusedCommentId=200704201#comment-200704201] we have another issue with the getRepositoryV2 method.'

Can you please release it to PAC/BAMEXT. 

This plugin does not seem to be on PAC.  It would be great if we could get it there.
fields.summary: Please fix the CheckStyle plugin to work with Bamboo 2.3

fields.description:
In JIRA we have a build that creates a nightly standalone snapshot. When you goto the artifacts screen you get the following:

!sizeof4kwtf.png!

It appears that bamboo is reporting the size of the directory inode (which is almost always 4k on ext?) rather than the size of the files in the directory (which should be 100MB+). 

We should either look at the files in the directory to calculate the size, or show no size at all.
fields.summary: Bamboo should report the size of the files in a directory and not the size of the directory itself.

fields.description: Turns out that Bamboo looks for test results as a sub directory of the build-dir. There was no indication that this was the case (either in Bamboo or the documentation). As a very minimum, it would be nice to have some more verbose error reporting from Bamboo when it cannot proceed due to an unexpected problem.
fields.summary: Be more verbose with "Tests not found" error

fields.description: We should use the bamboo icon for the installer image
fields.summary: Bamboo Installer Image unsexy

fields.description:
Being able to change Log levels and add new log classes at runtime for
* gathering debug traces without restarting bamboo
* switching between predefined production and diagnostic log level sets (Repository, user management, database)

Great value for customer support
fields.summary: implement runtime log level change in bamboo admin section

fields.description: Having a schedule configured as "no more than" e.g. "no more than 4" seems to kill all available instances, since it seems that it looks if the instance is on list (even if already scheduled to be shut down - agent stopped, but the instance is still on the list) instead of checking if given instance to be shut down has agent present or not.
fields.summary: The "no more than" instance schedule seems to shut down more instances than it should

fields.description:
New API returns different data for build. It'd be great if XML build description would be the same for each call returning build.

The old API is great because it has some fields decomposed as compared to the new one - for example - projectName, planName, buildKey, buildNumber, it's a lot easier to parse this data. Also having projectName and planName inside of this XML description is good because we don't have to do additional calls to get them.
fields.summary: Inconsistent data returned by /rest/api/latest/build and /api/rest/getRecentlyCompletedBuildResultsForBuild.action
